channel.title: Engadget
channel.description: Engadget is a web magazine with obsessive daily coverage of everything new in gadgets and consumer electronics
channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2021 Yahoo! Inc. All rights reserved

item.title: HTC 'Vive Air' wireless headset leaks on design award site
item.description: HTC Vive is getting set to release a fitness-focused VR headset called the Vive Air, according to a leak from the World Design Guide awards.

item.title: The Morning After: Turning pro in the NBA with an NFT
item.description: Today’s headlines: Fitbit's $150 Luxe is another attempt to make a stylish fitness tracker, NASA's Ingenuity becomes the first aircraft to fly on another planet, and EA announces 'Apex Legends Mobile'.

item.title: Sony is releasing its WH-1000XM4 headphones in white for a limited time
item.description: Sony is releasing a white version of its WH-1000XM4 headphones for a limited time in Europe.

item.title: Samsung SmartThings update helps prevent unwanted tag-based tracking
item.description: Samsung has unveiled an update to its SmartThings platform that includes Bixby voice control and a clever new feature that can detect if someone is tracking your location.

item.title: Venmo built crypto trading into its payments app
item.description: PayPal-owned payments company Venmo is rolling out the ability to buy and sell cryptocurrency to users.

item.title: Google Search turns Pac-Man and Hello Kitty into interactive AR objects
item.description: Google is putting a bunch of iconic Japanese characters in Search as augmented reality objects you can interact with.

item.title: Mercedes-Benz unveils the EQB, its first electric SUV for the US market
item.description: Mercedes-Benz has unveiled the EQB, a compact electric SUV that will be the automaker's first electric SUV to go on sale in the US.

item.title: Hackers stole driver's license numbers from Geico's website
item.description: Geico has filed a data breach notice with the California attorney general’s office, admitting that fraudsters had stolen customers' driver's license numbers from its website.

item.title: What's on TV this week: 'Mortal Kombat,' 'Shadow and Bone'
item.description: This week 'Mortal Kombat' streams on HBO Max, MLB the Show crosses over to Xbox, and Netflix dives into sci-fi and fantasy.

item.title: Elon Musk: Data recovered 'so far' shows Autopilot not enabled in Houston crash
item.description: Tesla 'technoking' Elon Musk said that so far, data logs show a Model S that hit a tree in Texas this weekend did not have Autopilot enabled.

item.title: ACLU and 70 other organizations ask DHS to stop using Clearview AI
item.description: More than 70 advocacy groups have called on the Department of Homeland Security to stop using Clearview AI's facial recognition software.

item.title: Jalen Suggs announces he's going pro with an NFT
item.description: With Suggs now heading to the NBA draft and expected to land somewhere among the top three picks, he’s auctioning off a commemorative NFT celebrating his semi-finals buzzer beater.

item.title: Toyota's first electric vehicle will hit the road in 2022
item.description: Toyota announced today it plans to sell around 70 different electric cars globally by the end of 2025, including 15 new fully electric models.

item.title: Facebook and Spotify will team up on 'Project Boombox'
item.description: Facebook and Spotify will team up on new music features that will allow people to listen to music while they use the Facebook app.

item.title: Facebook will remove calls for violence in preparation for Derek Chauvin verdict
item.description: As cities and communities across the US anxiously wait for a verdict in the trial of Derek Chauvin, the former police officer accused of killing George Floyd, Facebook says it's "doing what we can" to prepare.

item.title: EA announces 'Apex Legends Mobile,' with regional betas starting this month
item.description: It's completely separate from the PC and console versions of 'Apex Legends.'

item.title: Facebook introduces new audio features to compete with Clubhouse
item.description: Facebook will test several new audio features, including audio-only “rooms” for live chats, as well as “soundbites,” for sharing short voice messages, and a new podcasting feature.

item.title: Nextdoor will display 'anti-racism notification' if it notices discriminatory language
item.description: Nextdoor has introduced "anti-racism notifications" to prevent discriminatory language.

item.title: Sony reverses decision to close PS3 and Vita game stores this summer
item.description: 'It’s clear that we made the wrong decision here.'

item.title: Amazon's first Project Kuiper internet satellites will launch aboard Atlas V rockets
item.description: The rockets will help Amazon start putting the more than 3,200 satellites that will eventually make up its Project Kuiper constellation in low Earth orbit.

item.title: Reddit reveals its version of Clubhouse's audio chat rooms
item.description: AMAs could be about to get much more candid in Reddit Talk.

item.title: Fitbit's $150 Luxe is another attempt to make a stylish fitness tracker
item.description: The company is announcing the Fitbit Luxe today — which it's calling a "fashion-forward fitness and wellness tracker... in an effortlessly chic bracelet design."

item.title: Apple will allow Parler back onto the App Store
item.description: Proposed updates to the app and moderation practices were sufficient enough for Apple.

item.title: Discord softens its iOS NSFW server ban
item.description: Discord has partly lifted a ban on NSFW servers on iOS, letting you opt in to most of these chats.

item.title: Google offers virtual tours of UNESCO World Heritage sites
item.description: Explore Mount Kilimanjaro, the Taj Mahal, Yosemite National Park and many other locations.
